720533f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - King Street
720533f-a.text:
Hudson Street, east side, from Ling Street to West Houston
(formerly Hammersley) Street, inclusive, showing the Hudson
Street side of the two year old U. S. Appraisers' Stores
building, which occupies the entire block. The view is
from Charlton Street across the excavation on the west side
of Hudson Street where the Standard Statistics Building is
about to rise. Notice the pedestrians on Hudson Street, at
the right, stopping to watch the workmen in the excavation.
april 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720533f-a.folder: Hudson Street & King Street, Manhattan, NY

720731f-a.title: Manhattan: King Street - Hudson Street
720731f-a.text:
84, 94 King Street, east of, adjoining, and at the S.E. corner
of Hudson Street. No. 94 is the King Street side of the Evening
Graphic Building; No. 84 is a garage, less than six years old as
shown here. In the foreground is part of the clearing for the new
United States Appraisers' Stores (see Varick Street).
December 7, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720731f-a.folder: King Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720524f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - King Street
720524f-a.text:
Excavation for the new Standard Statistics Building, Hudson
Street, west side, from King Street to Charlton Street, a
side view from Eing Street.
April 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720524f-a.folder: Hudson Street & King Street, Manhattan, NY

733360f-b.title: Thanksgiving ragamuffins, No.31-33.
733360f-b.text:
(1)
Thanksgiving Ragamuffins, 1933, No. 31. A 1ittle girl applying
lipstick, at 367 Hdson Street, west side, between King and
West Houston Streets.
November 30, 1933.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
No. 32. This one got a very liberal application of lipstick.
The location is 381 Hudson Street, in the same block. Notice
the NRA Blue Eagle in the window; these had just come in
that fall.
Novomber 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
No. 33. In the same block, a group including the little tyke
shown in No. 32.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

Hudson Street, west side, north froa and includiag Eing Street,

ECdng Street.
April 23, 1930.

Hudson Street,West Side and south 3fcHouston from Clarkson Streets.

720531f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - King Street
720531f-a.text:
Hudson Street, at King Street, seen from cleared S.W. corner
(the Standard Statistics Building excavation). On the N.E. corner
is part of the new United States Appraisers' Stores building, now
two years old, which fills the entire block bounded by Hudson, King,
Varick, and West Houston Streets.
April 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720531f-a.folder: Hudson Street & King Street, Manhattan, NY

720732f.title: Manhattan: King Street - Hudson Street
720732f.text:
95, 97, 101 King Street, north side, adjoining the N.W. corner
of Hudson Street. The building in the center was originally the
Wesley Methodist Episcopal Church, during the 1850's; but it has
long since ceased to be a church. It will be demolished shortly
before 1910.
June 4, 1904.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720732f.folder: King Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720733f-a.title: Manhattan: King Street - Hidson Street
720733f-a.text:
(1)
113 to 95 King Street, north side, west of and towards Hudson
Streeu, seen fron. the clearing on the south side where the Stand:
Statistics Building is to be erected. Nos. 109, 107, 105, 103
are the four old houses with dormer windows; No. 101 has a flat
roof. No. 95 adjoins 363 Hudson Street, the corner building.
The one-story garage and lunch room at 97-99 King Street is less
than ten years old, it occupies the former site of the Wesley
Methodist Episcopal Church.
April 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO PEPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
99 to 121 King Street, north side, from west of Hudson Street
to the N.E. corner of Greenwich Street, a view taken on the same
day as the above and largely overlapping it. No. 115-121 King
Street is the paper box factory at the left.
April 23, 1930.
720733f-a.folder: King Street & Hidson Street, Manhattan, NY

720525f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - King Street
720525f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, from Ring Street to Charlton, showing
the entire block demolished early in 1935 to make room for
the new Standard Statisties Building. Nos. 387361, at the
S. W. corner of Ping Street, are three frame houses practic-
ally merged into one; and No. 353, adjoining, is a frame house
with brick facing. On these bulldings one dormer window can be
counted for each house number (odd) from 353 to 361, inclusive.
Au2ust 1e,1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720525f-a.folder: Hudson Street & King Street, Manhattan, NY

720526f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - King Street
720526f-a.text:
Evening Graphic Building, Hudson Street, east side, from King
Street to Charlton. In the foreground is part of the exca-
vation for the Standard Statistics Building.
April 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720526f-a.folder: Hudson Street & King Street, Manhattan, NY
